Posts.Content: I think when they call you back for a ultrasound, it's because they suspect a breast cyst. The ultrasound passes through them because they are liquid and with the mammogram, they can't tell for sure. I have had to have a ultrasound everytime I've had a mammogram and it's always turned out to be cysts. It's scary, but try not to worry to much.
Posts.Title: Ambiguous Mammogram Results 1 2

Posts.Content: I would definitely get a mammogram. I have problems with breast cysts also. They have always shown up on the mammogram and then they take a closer look at them with an ultrasound. Mine have always shown on ultrasound too. It probably is nothing but I would find a doctor who is willing to find out what is going on for your peace of mind. Good luck!
Posts.Title: question about breast ultrasound

Posts.Content: It sounds like a cyst. They can come and go with your period. It probably wouldn't be a bad idea to have a mammogram. I have had many cysts. Some I've had drained and some just go away by themselves. Do see a doctor to ease your mind. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Found lump, but now its gone

Posts.Content: I too have had breast cysts off and on for the last 3 years. I would definitely have a mammogram. The radiologist told me that the cysts don't hurt anything, but there is always the possibility of it hiding something else underneath it. I just had a conversation with my doctor on Monday about what to do when I find cysts. He told me that the thing to remember about cancer is that the lump would grow fast. With a cyst, it's probably painful and is not going to grow fast. He said if I can feel it getting smaller, it's nothing to worry about. I hope this is helpful.
Posts.Title: breast cyst

Posts.Content: It may be just a cyst that goes away after your peroid. If you are close to that time of the month, you can probably wait a few weeks and see if it goes away. If it doesn't go away though, make sure you have it checked out. I have had cysts many times. Sometimes they go away on there own, but not always. Good luck to you and keep us up to date.
Posts.Title: tiny lump in breast
